channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2024050130
item.description:
Report X-2024050130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was discovered damaged off work area 258 on the OB sort. The outer container was wet, and the identification arrows were not observed. Upon inspection found 1 bottle of the contents had a loose cap causing the leak of 50oz of the contents.

item.title: Report X-2024041396
item.description:
Report X-2024041396

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-02T15:12:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-23
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND LEAKING ON THE UNLOAD TRAILER FROM THE PREVIOUS FACILITY. THE CAPS CAME LOOSE ON 2 OF THE PLASTIC JUGS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT INTERNALLY AND COAT THE OTHER JUGS IN THE PACKAGE.
